eu.threecixty.privacy.datastorage
Interface ProfileManager

public interface ProfileManager

Public interface of the system managing controlled access to users profiles.

Nested Class Summary
static class ProfileManager.ProfileStatus
          Status of the profile

Method Detail

getAllUsersIDs

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllUsersIDs(Session session)
                                               throws ProfileException
Get the IDs of all the users stored in the database if the requester has the access rights to those data.

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester.
Returns:
A set of unique user ID. In case of denied access, the set will be empty
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue

getProfileStatus

ProfileManager.ProfileStatus getProfileStatus(Session session,
                                              java.lang.String userID)
                                              throws ProfileException
Get the current status of the profile of a user

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
Returns:
The current status
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue

getProfile

java.lang.String getProfile(Session session,
                            java.lang.String userID)
                            throws ProfileException
Get the whole profile of a user, filtered according to the rights and domain of the requester ( this profile could be incomplete because some data are not accessible)

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
Returns:
A string that contains the serialization of the profile. The serialization format is JSON-LD. Null if there is no profile for the specified user
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue

getProfileProperties

java.lang.String getProfileProperties(Session session,
                                      java.lang.String userID,
                                      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> propertyPaths)
                                      throws ProfileException
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED Get a user profile with only some preferences, filtered according to the rights and domain of the requester

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
propertyPaths - A list of SPARQL1.1 Property Path (path to a element of the ontology profile)
Returns:
A string that contains the serialization of the profile. The serialization format is JSON-LD.
Throws:
ProfileException - if a property path has not the appropriate format
ProfileException - In case of session issue

mergeProfile

void mergeProfile(Session session,
                  java.lang.String userID,
                  java.lang.String JSONLDProfile)
                  throws ProfileException
Ask for the merge between a current user profile stored in the database and a user profile specified in its JSON-LD serialization. If the user profile does not exist in the database, it will be created. This method could be used to simply create a user profile in the database.

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
JSONLDProfile - The user profile to be merged with the stored profile Obviously, those operations are submitted to sufficient access rights
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue
ProfileException - if the provided profile has not the appropriate format

mergeProfileProperties

void mergeProfileProperties(Session session,
                            java.lang.String userID,
                            java.util.Collection<ValuedProperty> pairsPropertyPathValues)
                            throws ProfileException
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED Ask for the merge between a current user profile stored in the database and a set of valued properties. If the user profile does not exist in the database, it will be created. This method could be used to simply create a user profile in the database.

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
pairsPropertyPathValues - A set of pairs of <PropertyPath>/<new Property Values>
  1. If the aimed property is functional(only one value per instance):
    • the values list must contain only one value
    • the property value will be replaced by the value specified in the list
  2. If the aimed property is not-functional (multiple values )
    • a new property will be added for all values in the list
Obviously, those operations are submitted to sufficient access rights
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue
ProfileException - if property paths have not the appropriate format

replaceProfile

void replaceProfile(Session session,
                    java.lang.String userID,
                    java.lang.String JSONLDProfile)
                    throws ProfileException
Ask for the replacement of a current user profile stored in the database by a user profile specified in its JSON-LD serialization. If the user profile does not exist in the database, nothing is done.

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
JSONLDProfile - The user profile that will replace the stored profile Obviously, those operations are submitted to sufficient access rights
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue
ProfileException - if the provided profile has not the appropriate format

replaceProfileProperties

void replaceProfileProperties(Session session,
                              java.lang.String userID,
                              java.util.Collection<ValuedProperty> pairsPropertyPathValues)
                              throws ProfileException
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED Ask for the replacement of some properties values in the current user profile stored in the database by others properties. The user profile must exist in the database.

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
pairsPropertyPathValues - Map that contains pairs of <PropertyPath>/<new Property Values>
  1. If the aimed property is functional(only one value per instance):
    • if the value list is empty => the property will be removed
    • if the list contains one value => the property value will be replaced by the new value
    • if the list contains more than one value => the modification is cancelled
  2. If the aimed property is not-functional (multiple values )
    • if the value list is empty => all property values will be removed
    • otherwise => all previous values will be removed and one property value will be added for each new value
Obviously, those operations are submitted to sufficient access rights
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue
ProfileException - if property paths have not the appropriate format

deleteProfile

boolean deleteProfile(Session session,
                      java.lang.String userID)
                      throws ProfileException
Ask for the deletion of the profile of a user

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
Returns:
true if the profile has been deleted, otherwise false (for example if the requester has no sufficient rights to delete it)
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue

deleteProfileProperties

void deleteProfileProperties(Session session,
                             java.lang.String userID,
                             java.util.Collection<ValuedProperty> pairsPropertyPathValues)
                             throws ProfileException
NOT YET IMPLEMENTED Ask for the deletion of some properties of the profile of a user The properties values will be deleted according to the requester rights.

Parameters:
session - The current session of the requester
userID - ID of the user in the database
pairsPropertyPathValues - Map that contains pairs of PropertyPath/Values
  1. If the aimed property is functional(only one value per instance):
    • the values list will not be used : the property is automatically deleted
  2. If the aimed property is not-functional (multiple values )
    • if the values list is null => all properties will be deleted
    • if the values list is not empty => only the specified values will be removed
Obviously, those deletions are submitted to sufficient access rights
Throws:
ProfileException - In case of session issue
ProfileException - If property paths have not the appropriate format
